result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Emil A Booher was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Defendant Emil A Booher in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Set for a Motion Hearing with regards to revision of the judgment for the IID/occupational license request.

10:12 a.m.   Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court has reviewed the motions that had been filed.
Defendant seeks an order rescinding the statutorily imposed installation requirement of the IID and that he be eligible for an occupational license.
Court makes additional statements with regards to the IID.
Court would ask Atty Redfield to show him the authority that would allow the Court to grant an order rescinding the statutorily imposed installation requirement of the IID and that he be eligible for an occupational license.
Atty Redfield makes his statements with regards to the IID issue.
Atty Redfield provides the State and the Court with medical records as documentation for the reasons as to why the defendant is not able to have an IID.
Atty Cousins responds to the statements of Atty Redfield.
Atty Redfield responds.
Atty Redfield will now make his record with regards to the occupational license.
10:27 a.m.  Defendant is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.
10:33 a.m.  Exhibit #D1 is marked for Atty Redfield and referenced.
10:34 a.m.  Exhibit #D2 is marked for Atty Redfield and referenced.
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court.
Atty Redfield responds to the statements of Atty Cousins.
10:45 a.m.  Witness is excused.

BY THE COURT:
Per Statute the Court is not allowed to exempt the defendants Toyota with regards to the IID.
Per Statute the defendant is not eligible for an occupational license due to his revocation's.
Court DENIES the motion's brought before the Court.
Clerk to file document discussed on the record in case 15CF346.

Defendant Emil A Booher in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CF346, and 13CT349.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF346 OWI 3rd Ct 1: No Contest
(13CT349 - found guilty by jury prior)

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF346 Ct 1 and (13CT349 ct 1 was found guilty by Jury trial).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CF346 cts 2 and 13CT349 ct 2 are dismissed. 15CF346 ct 2 is dismissed and read in.

2:19 p.m. BTC: Court finds there was a freely, voluntarily, and knowing waived right to counsel and the Motion for Collateral Attack is denied.
